We have partnered with Brave Search to bring their search results into Kagi. Brave joins the growing list of Kagi's search sources, ensuring that if you can not find something on Kagi, it does not exist on the web. This will come at no additional cost to you, thanks to continuous optimizations in our search stack.

We vastly improved Image search results. Check them here including all the powerful filters.

entry.title: How Iâ€™ve Studied the Bible
entry.summary: Years ago, I realized that the Bible is the foundational book of Western civilization. If I was going to be an educated person, I needed to know what it said. The post How Iâ€™ve Studied the Bible appeared first on David Perell.

entry.title: Year in Review
entry.summary:
The last time I wrote a â€œyear in reviewâ€ post was 2017, and before that in 2012. Reading my old writing is nostalgic and horrific.
By the numbers, 2023 was pretty normal: I read around 20 books, ran around 400 miles. Itâ€™s funny how the statistics even out to the same numbers when, during the year, I think Iâ€™m in a reading drought or, like several months this year, hadnâ€™t run in weeks. What was the best?
I think that the best book in general that I read was Achieving Our Country by Richard Rorty. I think Iâ€™ve been politically shifting for a while now â€“Â not to the left or the right, but around questions of reform versus radicalism, unification versus schism. Rorty isnâ€™t the last word on the matter, but reading him was inspiring because it opened my eyes to the other possibilities of how tâ€¦

entry.title: Azure Container Apps Jobs in a secure Landing Zone
entry.summary: Customers in their migration/modernization journey to cloud want to update their apps to be compatible with the cloud and rebuild the apps as microservices that involve tasks that run for a short time and deployed into a secure container infrastructure and ready for production. For these scenarios, Azure Container Apps Landing Zone Accelerator can help the users start with the best practices included to speed up their production process. Â Azure Container Apps (ACA) Landing Zone Accelerator provides packaged design guidance on critical design areas with reference architecture backed by reference implementation to help users build and deploy containerized apps to Azure Container Apps in an enterprise landing zone design. Landing Zone Accelerator has been built on the lessons we learned withâ€¦

entry.title: Homeownership
entry.summary: Most people I know fit into one of two camps: they either want to buy a house and they canâ€™t, or theyâ€™ve bought a house. The desire to own ones own home is almost universal in the people I know in the US. Itâ€™s even stronger for folks who live outside of major cities. And people for whom the â€œsecurityâ€ part of homeownership rings stronger - who grew up in instability or in countries where physical goods are preferred to financial instruments for savings. I donâ€™t want to buy a house. Maybe Iâ€™ll need to, but I canâ€™t help but think that the milestone is vastly overrated in public imagination and there are problems with it on a personal and societal level. Economics Houses are non-diversified, illiquid holdings that make up too large a percentage of peopleâ€™s total invested assets. Your neighborâ€¦

entry.title: Troubleshooting Guide: Resolving Azure App Services Image Pull Issues from Azure Container Registry
entry.summary: Welcome to our comprehensive guide dedicated to resolving challenges that arise when Azure App Services encounter difficulties pulling images from the Azure Container Registry (ACR). Deploying applications seamlessly often hinges on a smooth image retrieval process, and encountering obstacles during this phase can disrupt the entire deployment workflow. Â In this guide, we'll delve into a step-by-step checklist meticulously designed to diagnose and troubleshoot these issues effectively. From initial authentication, those include Admin Credentials, Managed Identity and access permissions to navigating complex network configurations for both Public and Private ingress on the ACR, this resource aims to be your go-to reference for untangling and resolving image pull issues within the Azure ecâ€¦

entry.title: Java on Azure Container Apps - Build and deploy polyglot apps in two simple steps
entry.summary:
Welcome to the first episode of the Java on Azure Container Apps blog series! In case you missed the introductory episode, you can read it here to get a sense of what itâ€™s about and what you can expect to see in the future. This blog is based on the Spring Petclinic project with a REST backend and an Angular frontend. The objective is to build and deploy Petclinic on Azure Container Apps and weâ€™ll carry it out in 2 steps:
Build and deploy a Spring REST app to Azure Container Apps directly from the source. Package the front-end Angular app in a container first and deploy it to Azure Container Apps.
Build and deploy a Spring app to Azure Container Apps As a developer, you always want to prioritize retaining the inner loop workflow and developer experience during the coding and testing phaâ€¦

entry.title: Troubleshoot intermittent connectivity issue in azure app service
entry.summary: In this article Â Â Â LinuxÂ Â Â Â Â Â nslookupÂ Â Â Â Â Â digÂ Â Â Â Â Â NodeJSÂ Â Â Â Â Â PythonÂ Â Â Â Â Â tcppingÂ Â Â Â Â Â curlÂ Â Â Â Â Â tcpdumpÂ Â Â Â WindowsÂ Â Â Â Â Â nameresolver.exeÂ Â Â Â Â Â tcpping.exeÂ Â Â Â Â Â curl.exeÂ Â Â Â Â Â WebjobÂ For application running on Azure App Service, sometimes the code throwing error to connect to target service due to intermittent connectivity issue.To identify the issue, it's not convenient if we keep modify and deploy the code, we could use App Service Kudu site to do some quick testing and no need to change any code. Linux Login to your app service Kudu site, e.g. https://<appname>.scm.azurewebsites.net, and navigate to "SSH" menu. You should be able to see SSH shell.If you are using custom image, then you need enable it by follow document:Â https://learn.micrâ€¦

entry.title: Supercharge collaboration apps with Large Language Models and Azure SignalR Service
entry.summary:
Further facilitate teamwork in collaboration apps with Large Language Models Apps like Microsoft Loop, Figma, Notion, Miro, Framer are redefining remote collaboration. Beyond hosting the newest and latest version of a file, these modern collaboration apps allow users to make edits to the same file at the same time as if they were physically next to each other.
With the rise of large language models (LLMs) and their increasingly sophisticated capabilities, weâ€™d like to explore how AI can further facilitate teamwork using the aforementioned collaboration applications. Â Â AI agent as another human collaborator The mainstream way of interacting with a language model is through a familiar chat interface. One characteristic about this interaction thatâ€™s relevant to our discussion is that itâ€™sâ€¦

entry.title: This Month In Azure Static Web Apps | November & December 2023
entry.summary:
Welcome to this monthâ€™s newsletter. We round up the latest news, product announcements, content and community highlights â€“ in one compact post.Â Â
View the newsletter archives:Â https://aka.ms/swa/thismonthÂ Â Catch the community livestream:Â https://aka.ms/swa/community/standups
Azure Static Web Apps LivestreamÂ The Community Standups livestream happens on the last Thursday of each month. Join us for the next oneÂ for someÂ interactive demo and discussions. Â This was our last livestream of 2023, but join us again in January as we kickoff the new year with some announcements. This month we walk through using Static Web Apps to build OpenAI chat applications with retrieval augmented generated responses.Â Check outÂ past episodesÂ for more exciting demos and guests!Â Â Community HighlightsÂ Recent Azure Static Web Apps announcements:
Build serverless full-stack .NET 8 applications with Blazor WebAssembly and Azure Static Web Apps
Community highlights:
Combining the powers of Azure SWA and APIs - Poornima Nayar - Copenhagen DevFest 2023 - YouTube (Video) Azure Static Web Appsã‚’ä½¿ã£ã¦Nuxt3ã‚µã‚¤ãƒˆã‚’ãƒ‡ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚¤ã—ã¦ã¿ãŸ #Node.js â€“ Qiita (Blog) Publish HTML project using Azure Static Web Apps | by Marc Kenneth Lomio & Melrose Mejidana | Nov, 2023 | Medium A Re-Platforming Journey from Gatsby to Astro (blueboxes.co.uk)
New & updated documentation:
Tutorial: Deploy a React app on Azure Static Web Apps | Microsoft Learn Tutorial: Deploy an Angular app on Azure Static Web Apps | Microsoft Learn Tutorial: Deploy a Vue app on Azure Static Web Apps | Microsoft Learn Deploy a Blazor app on Azure Static Web Apps | Microsoft Learn
Â Upcoming events
Our first community standup of the new year in January 2024, last Thursday of the month! Follow us on Twitter to get notified.

entry.title: The countdown is on! Discover resources to upgrade your App Service Environment today
entry.summary: Since the announcement of the retirement of App Service Environment v1 and v2, we have been encouraged by the velocity with which organizations have begun upgrading to the latest version. If your organization hasnâ€™t yet made the switch, consider this blog a gentle nudge to prioritize your migration to App Service Environment v3 before the Aug. 31, 2024, deadline.Â As a reminder, starting on Jan. 15, 2024, users will no longer be able to create a new App Service Environment v1 or v2. Even though support for existing v1 or v2 environments will continue until the Aug. 31 deadline, App Service Environment created after Jan 15 will be on version 3.Â To avoid potential disruptions and ensure the seamless operation of your services, we strongly recommend initiating the migration process without delâ€¦

entry.title: Preview of Durable Functions Extension v3.0.0
entry.summary:
We have just released the preview of a new major version of the Durable Functions extension!Â Â Durable Functions (DF) enables you to write long-running, reliable, event-driven, and stateful logic on theÂ Azure Functions platform using everyday imperative code.Â Â There are two major changes introduced in this release: upgrading to the latest version of the Azure Storage SDK (a breaking change for .NET in-process apps) and the introduction of a new partition manager. We describe these and the motivation for each in the sections below.Â Â Please note:Â
At this time, DF extension v3.0.0-rc.1 is only supported in the App Service Plan. Auto-scaling support for the Consumption and Elastic Premium plans will be announced later.Â Durable Functions v3 does not support Azure Functions runtime V1.Â Â â€¦

entry.title: Build and deploy .NET 8 Blazor WASM apps with serverless APIs using Azure Static Web Apps
entry.summary: With the release of .NET 8, Blazor has evolved from a client-first web UI framework to a full-stack web UI framework. This announcement introduced new rendering modes and interactivity, allowing more flexibility to choose the right rendering mode for your Blazor web apps. In this article, weâ€™ll take a closer look at standalone Blazor WebAssembly (WASM) projects, their considerations relative to other Blazor rendering modes, and how we can build full-stack .NET 8 serverless apps on Azure Static Web Apps with Blazor WASM and Functions APIs. Â .NET 8 Blazor rendering modes & hosting considerations Â In .NET 8, Blazor has introduced a unified full-stack model, the Blazor Web App. This model enables you to opt for any of the various supported rendering modes (client rendering, server-side rendeâ€¦

entry.title: Running Java applications on Azure Container Apps
entry.summary: Developers love containerization for its ability to ensure consistency, portability and manageability of their applications, while aligning with modern DevOps practices. Azure Container Apps is a great platform for running polyglot apps and containers of all kinds in Azure, as it abstracts away the complexity of managing underlying Kubernetes while providing unified networking, observability, and scaling for higher developer velocity. While it serves as a versatile container platform, it may not offer precise insights into your Java applications or the state of your Java execution environment (such as the JVM). To better cater to our Java-centric customers running containerized apps, we've recently initiated a new journey to enhance the Java developer experience on Azure Container Apps. Â â€¦

entry.title: Migration of Azure Virtual Network injected Azure Data Explorer cluster to Private Endpoints
entry.summary: If you are using VNet injection to secure your Azure Data Explorer (ADX) cluster, you may face some challenges such as complexity, scalability, and public IP dependency. We recommend that you switch to Azure Private Endpoints, which allow you to connect to your cluster privately within your VNet. We have released a preview feature that lets you migrate your VNet injected ADX cluster to Private Endpoints easily and quickly.

entry.title: Secret scanning now detects new secrets in GitHub Discussion content
entry.summary: Secret scanning now detects new secrets in GitHub Discussion content The post Secret scanning now detects new secrets in GitHub Discussion content appeared first on The GitHub Blog.

entry.title: Bugtracker migration to GitLab completed
entry.summary: We are happy to announce that the migration of the bugtracker to GitLab is done! ðŸ¥³ Thanks to everyone who has helped during the migration! This means the issue tracker and merge requests on the GitLab package repos are now enabled. The old bugtracker will subsequently be closed down. For archiving reasons there will be a static copy so that links (for example the randomly picked Task #56716) are still stable, migrated bugs have a closing comment pointing to the new URL on GitLab. Packaging bugs are now opened on the repo hosting the corresponding packaging sources, the "Add a new Bug" button on the package page on archlinux.org will automatically direct you to the correct place to open the issue. The workflow afterwards is mostly the same, first our Bug Wranglers will have a look at the issues and triage them, and then they will be handed over to the respective Package Maintainers to fix. A list of all issues can be found here. If you do not have an account for GitLab already (which authenticates against our SSO service), please write us a mail with your desired username to accountsupport@archlinux.org as advised in the banner.

entry.title: Mental illness plays havoc with the mind as well as the heart
entry.summary: We need to pay more attention to the physical impacts of mental illness. It could not only be messing with your mind, but also your heart, say scientists.

entry.title: Acute sleep loss may alter the way we see others
entry.summary: A new study shows that young adults when sleep-deprived evaluate angry faces as less trustworthy and healthy-looking. Furthermore, neutral and fearful faces appear less attractive following sleep loss.

entry.title: Molecular basis of deep sleep pinpointed, suggests avenues for novel treatments
entry.summary: Scientists pinpoint the molecular epicenter of deep-sleep regulation. The findings, based on research in mice, identify a gene that makes a protein that regulates delta waves -- electrical signals between neurons that occur during the deepest phases of relaxation and are a hallmark of restorative sleep.

entry.title: New sleep molecule discovered: 'It shows just how complex the machinery of sleep is'
entry.summary: Researchers presents a new study demonstrating that a small molecule in brain cells affects the level of hypocretin, which is responsible for making us feel awake during the day and tired at night. People with a genetic variation of this molecule have a higher risk of suffering from daytime sleepiness.

entry.title: Seven hours of sleep is optimal in middle and old age, say researchers
entry.summary: Seven hours is the ideal amount of sleep for people in their middle age and upwards, with too little or too much little sleep associated with poorer cognitive performance and mental health, say researchers.

entry.title: Risky driving behaviors increase as common sleep disorder worsens
entry.summary: Up to half of older adults may have sleep apnea, a condition in which breathing and sleep are briefly interrupted many times a night. A new study shows that this chronic tiredness can have serious implications for road safety.

entry.title: Automated cognitive behavioral therapy for insomnia delivered over the internet shown to be highly effective in Black women
entry.summary: Black women are disproportionately affected by poor sleep, which is associated with increased risk of adverse outcomes such as cardiovascular disease, depression and worse quality of life. The gold standard treatment for insomnia is cognitive behavioral therapy for insomnia (CBT-I), which specifically targets the individual's problematic sleep behaviors and beliefs.

entry.title: Drug reduced frequency of breathing pauses in sleep apnea
entry.summary: A new study has paved the way for the first drug treatment for sleep apnea. Compared to before receiving the treatment, breathing pauses decreased with on average more than 20 per hour for patients given the drug.
